Silva is an Assistant Professor in Computer Science at the University of Iowa. He recently received a PhD from the Department of Informatics at University of California Irvine.Â Research InterestsHis research focuses on designing, developing, and evaluating systems to support health and well-being for individuals and families. He uses human-centered design approaches to understand people's perspectives and everyday experiences with technology use, including co-designing interactions and field deployment evaluations of working prototypes.Research Interests (Keywords)HCI; Health and Wellbeing; Family InformaticsSelected PublicationsCo-Designing Situated Displays for Family Co-Regulation with ADHD Children.
